subclass.name: Broken Mind Domain
subclassFeatures: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness|Cleric||Broken Mind|Nuaria|2

subclassFeature.name: Broken Mind Domain
entries: Life. It doesn’t have an intrinsic meaning. Randomness, luck, destiny, free will are all expressions of the same concept. Will you try to control that which is uncontrollable or tame the beast that rides its master and fail constantly? Or will you leave it all to chance and leave to the fullest? Daasis knows, and Daasis will provide.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: The Toll of Knowledge
entries: Your mind is broken and impossible to understand. To the outsider, you seem crazy and full of madness. In reality, you’re constantly trying to understand the meaning of everything and nothing while trying not to lose your mind in the process.

At 1st level, Your mind can’t be read or detected, creatures can’t telepathically communicate with you unless you allow it, and you have advantage on saving throws against any effect that would determine whether you are telling the truth.

Roll or choose a madness from the {@table indefinite madness} table. It cannot be cured less of a {@spell wish} spell. Additionally, choose between the {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History} or {@skill Religion} skills. You can roll with advantage the chosen skill. You must finish a short rest to benefit from this feature again.
At 8th level you also become immune to the charmed condition.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your channel divinity to create a space to treat creatures according to their mental well-being.

As an action, you present your holy symbol, and a sphere of a purple colour emanates from you. The sphere is centered on you, has a 30-foot radius, and is filled with dim purple light. The sphere moves with you, and it lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated or die. Whenever a creature (including you) is in the sphere, they get one of these effects:

items: If you see the creature as friendly, they get advantage on Wisdom saving throws or saving throws that would make them charmed or frightened, as long they are inside the sphere.

If you see the creature as an enemy, they get disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. In addition to that, you can try to damage your enemies’ minds. At the start of your turn, you can use your action to deal psychic damage to hostile creatures inside your sphere’s aura. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 + your Cleric level psychic damage. Constructs and undeads automatically succeed this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: A Mightier Mind
entries: At 6th level, if you get hit by an attack you can spend your reaction to try to force your attacker to target another creature instead of you. It must succeed on  a Wisdom saving throw or attack another creature within the reach of the attack. If two or more creatures are equally closer, the target is chosen at random. If there are no other possible targets, the attacker doesn’t attack and loses its action.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Shatter
entries: You can share a glimpse of your perception of reality with a creature, which probably will break its mind

At 17th level, you can touch a creature. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spellcasting DC or be {@condition incapacitated} for one minute or until you stop touching the creature. Additionally, it takes {@dice 2d8} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
You must finish a short rest before using this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Dusk Domain
entries: As stated in the Glooming Letters, sometimes darkness must be fought with darkness and lies with lies.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Charming Lies
entries: You can use words to convince enemies that you are more of an ally than an enemy.

At 1st level, when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its next turn or until it takes damage. Creatures  are immune to this effect if they don't share a language with you or if they have already been charmed by you in this way within the last 24 hours.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Also at 1st level, you are proficient with the {@skill deception} skill and the {@skill performance}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Betrayal
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to backstab those who were foolish enough to trust you.
When you roll damage against a creature that is {@condition charmed} by you, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Foul play
entries: You know how to strike an enemy by using nasty tricks.
At 6th level, when you have advantage on attack rolls against a creature and take the Attack action, you can use you bonus action to make an additional attack.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, the cleric gains the ability to infuse his or her weapon strikes with divine poison. Once on each of the cleric's turns when he or she hits a creature with a weapon attack, the cleric can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage to the target. When the cleric reaches 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Treason
entries: You are an expert at foul playing and keeping the trust from your enemies at the same time.

At 17th level, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures who are {@condition charmed} by you. Additionally, when a creature is {@condition charmed} by you, the charmed effect does not end as a result of that creature taking damage.

spell.name: Frostball (WIP)

components.m: a tiny ball of snow and sulfur

entries: A fast blue light flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and a chunk of ice grows on it. It then explodes into tiny ice shards in all directions. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} cold damage and is knocked {@condition prone} by the ice on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Freezing Winds

components.m: an ice shard from a frozen water elemental

entries: Freezing and violent winds rise at your command and travel along a 40 feet long and 10 feet wide line from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The path covered by the winds is covered by magical snow and becomes dificult terrain for 1 minute.
If there is non-magical snow on the ground along the line, the spell deals an additional {@dice 4d6} of cold damage.
The winds lift tiny objects that are loose on its path.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ice Shards
entries: Five frozen shards appear and float around you and you can throw them at targets within range. You can use your bonus action to throw them one at a time or your action to throw all your remaining shards at once.
Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional shard for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blizzard

components.m: a cool material component

entries: Strong sustained magical winds blow in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, ice and snow circulate violently inside the cylinder.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed by the blizzard, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d10} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Creatures of size Medium or smaller make their saving throw with disadvantage. If they fail, their speed is also halved until the start of their next turn. Additionally, creatures inside the blizzard have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the blizzard up to 15 feet in any direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|3-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cool Moves
entries: For the duration, you can add your Dexterity modifier to Charisma ({@skill performance}) checks.

spell.name: Frost Barrier

time.condition: which you take when you or an ally are the target of a ranged attack you can witness.

entries: You raise a wall of magical snow on an unoccupied space within range to protect you or an ally from an incoming missile.
The wall is at most 15 feet long and 15 feet tall but always 5 feet thick and has 10 AC and 10 hit points. It is vulnerable to fire damage and lasts for 1 minute before melting or until destroyed.

The wall acts as a full cover for all creatures of size Large or smaller that are behind it. If any of the creatures behind the wall was a target of an incoming ranged attack, the attack targets the wall instead.
If the missile deals damage that exceeds the wall's maximum hit points, the original target takes the remaining damage if the attack roll would hit it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2nd or higher, the wall's maximum hit points increases by either 5 hit points or 5 feet (your choice) for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Shackles

components.m: a piece of iron and a piece of ice

entries: Magical shackles of freezing-cold ice appear on the limbs of a creature you can see within range. It makes  then a Strength saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} on a failed save. At the start of each of its turns, the creature repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} on a failed save and the spell ends on a succesful one.
Oozes and other creatures that don't have limbs can't be targeted by this spell.

spell.name: Snowshoes
entries: Choose a number of creatures equal to 1 + your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) that walk with two legs within range. Their footwear or their feet get the ability to walk over snow or ice without problem. These creatures ignore dificult terrain from ice or snow.

spell.name: Ice Blade
entries: You freeze moisture from the air to create a sword of solidified magical ice in your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d8} cold damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60). In addition, when you use the sword to attack a target that on an arctic environment, you make the attack roll with advantage.
If you drop the weapon or throw it, it melts at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause another sword to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Cael's Absolute Zero
entries: You sap even the slightest trace of heat from a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range.

All fire in the area is extinguished, and each creature in the area takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage. A creature that takes this damage must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is completely frozen in place, becoming {@condition paralyzed} for the duration.
When an affected creature takes fire damage, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on the creature.
A creature killed by this spell becomes a permanent statue of ice.

spell.name: Fridge
entries: You magically alter the heat flow of creatures inside a 15-foot cube centered on a point you can see within range.
All creatures within the cube make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} cold damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

One side of the cube, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals  {@damage 1d6} fire damage plus an additional {@dice 1d6}  per each creature Small or larger inside the cube that failed its saving throw, to each creature that fails a Constitution saving throw and ends its turn within 10 feet of that side.
You can repeat this effect as an action on each or your turns until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cold Heart
entries: You touch a creature. For the duration of the spell it can't feel any emotions, is immune to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}, and has disadvantage on Charisma checks.
Unwilling creatures can make a charisma saving throw to resist the spells effect, both when it is cast, and at the end of each of their turns.

spell.name: Sense Heat
entries: For the duration, you can sense the presence and location of significant heat sources within 60 feet, such as fire or warm-blooded creatures. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been in contact with a significant heat source within the last 10 minutes.
Paladin, Ranger, Wizard

spell.name: Boreal Beam
entries: A beam of light of varying colour blasts out from your finger in a direction you choose. Creatures in a 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} radiant damage and are {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a succesful save a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.
At the end of each of their turns, affected creatures repeat the save and are no longer {@condition blinded} on a success.
If you cast this spell when an aurora is visible on the sky, this spell does an additional {dice {@damage 1d10} of damage.

spell.name: Iceberg (WIP)
entries: This spell requires a body of water at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. You create a Gargantuan formation of ice and put it in the path of a ship.

Any ship within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d12} piercing damage on a failed save and no damage and is diverted 5 feet to one of the sides of the ice block on a succesful save.
reword the intro from the whirpool option of the control water spell
get away by giving some sample size

spell.name: Release Warmth (WIP)
entries: You slowly release the warmth from inside a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage on a failed save, has disadvantage on attack rolls, Constitution saving throws to mantain concentration and its speed is halved until the spell ends.
At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, the damage it takes is increased by a {@dice 1d8} and the spell ends on a successful one.
Creatures that are not warm such as undead or constructs are immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd- or 3rd-level spell slot, the initial damage increases to {@dice 2d8}. When you cast it using a 4th- or 5th-level spell slot, the initial damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 6th- or 7th-level spell slot, the initial damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Coldbomb (Beta)

components.m: a piece of ice and sulfur

entries: You violently concentrate cold air from the sorroundings to quickly unleash in an explosion. Choose a point you can see within range. Each creature on a 20-foot radius sphere makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a succesful one.
You may use your action to empower the spell and cast it on your next turn instead, which increases the damage of the spell to {@dice 8d8}.
If your concentration is broken before you cast this spell, you cast it centerd on yourself.

spell.name: Daasis's Roll of Madness
entries: You unleash a torrent of conflicting thoughts and ideas in the mind of one creature you can see within range, damaging its pysche and altering its behaviour. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be infused by dissonant thoughts. Roll a {@dice 1d6}. It gains one of the following negative effects.

items: The target takes the Attack action and targets the nearest creature it can see within range of the attack at random. It moves towards the target if it's a melee attack and can reach the target. If it cannot reach any target, it takes the Dash action instead and moves towards the nearest creature it can see.
The target screams loudly and raises its arms (if they have any) and drops everything it is holding. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws.
The target drops to the ground and acts normally on its turn but must remain {@condition prone}
The target is {@condition frightened} by you.
The target starts laughing uncontrollably and loses the ability to speak normally.
The dissonant thoughts are extremely intense. The target takes {@damage 1d12} of psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, it takes {@damage 1d12} psychic damage, and it can then make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Coin Toss

components.m: A coin

entries: Whenever you see a creature within range attempting an attack or a saving throw, you can let fate decide. Toss a coin (or roll a {@dice 1d2}). On heads (or a 1) it adds +2 to the roll and on tails (or a 2) it adds -2.
A creature is not a valid target of this spell if it's already being targetted by this spell.

spell.name: Madness Spike
entries: Choose a creature within range. The creature gets imbued with psychic energy attacking it through the nervous system. The creature must succed a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} psychic damage. Roll a {@dice 1d8}. On a roll of 8, the target is also {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. This cantrip does not affect non-intelligent constructs or undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mental Breakdown (WIP)
entries: Spell

spell.name: Asylum (WIP PSYC TERR)
entries: Cube, psychic damage increase. Sav throws for {@condition frightened}. Sav throw per turn and failed, spends reaction. Creatures with Int lower than X immune.

spell.name: Paranoia (WIP)
entries: You imbue a creature within a state of paranoia. This creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of every creature they see within 30 feet of them.

While {@condition frightened} by this spell, the creature must take the Attack action and make a range attack against the closest creature it is {@condition frightened} by, provided they are within range and can make such attack.
A creature repeats the saving throw again at the end of their turn. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Encore
entries: You set the thoughts of a creature you can see in a loop.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature repeats the last Action it took within the last minute. The repeated Action is identical in every way to the original Action. Furthermore, the creature cannot use reactions or bonus actions while affected. If the creature cannot repeat the Action, the creature stands still doing nothing instead.
An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

spell.name: Acidic Glob (by Izzy)

components.m: a drop of acid

entries: You release a ball of acid at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} acid damage. This acid does not damage objects, but instead removes nonmagical inks, blood, and similar staining liquids in an area no bigger than 3-foot on a side. The acidic ball then evaporates.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Twin Viper Strike (by Izzy)
entries: Two green ethereal fangs appear about your hands as you strike out. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range with advantage. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} poison damage. If no effect removed the advantage, and both rolls would hit the creature, it instead takes {@damage 1d10} poison damage and it has disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check it makes until the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4} or {@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4} or {@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4} or {@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Claws of Acamar (By SgtBriar)
entries: You unleash black, crackling energies from the corpse-star Acamar that streak toward a creature in range, intent on drawing others into the star's soul devouring depths. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage and is phased out for 1 minute, partially plunged into Acamar's realm. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

While phased out, the target deals half damage, has resistance to all damage except necrotic damage, and creatures have advantage on saving throws the target forces them to make. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, and ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Doom of Delban (by SgtBriar)

components.m: a frozen telescope lens

entries: You call on Delban to destroy a creature in range, its inexorable hatred manifesting as a single shaft of utterly cold and eldritch starlight that clings to your foes. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell is turned into a statue of brittle white ice.

On subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to shift and intensify the starlight, forcing a creature in range to make another Constitution saving throw. When you do so, the cold damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d8}, plus another {@dice 2d8} for each time you've used your action this way during the spell's duration to a maximum of {@dice 12d8}, and you take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, plus another {@dice 1d8} for each time you've used your action this way during the spell's duration to a maximum of {@dice 4d8}, as direct contact with Delban saps your life essence. This necrotic damage ignores resistance and immunity, but doesn't force you to make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

spell.name: Maw of Acamar (by SgtBriar)

m.text: a pure black onyx, worth at least 1,000gp

entries: You manifest a sliver of Acamar's all-consuming hunger into the world, taking the form of a 3-inch black sphere of nothingness that leaps from the onyx to a space in range. When a creature starts its turn or moves within 15 feet of the sphere, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 7d8} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell is sucked into Acamar's realm through the sphere and devoured, body and soul, and can only be brought back to life by divine intervention or the use of a wish spell.

As a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can move the sphere up to 20 feet. Once per turn, when the sphere moves directly into a creature, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 7d8} necrotic damage, be {@condition frightened} of the sphere until the end of its next turn, and move at least 15 feet away from it on its next turn if possible, as Acamar's depths reach for its soul.

A momentary lapse in concentration while channeling this spell has dire consequences. If your concentration is broken as the result of a failed Constitution saving throw, the sphere doesn't disappear. Instead, it persists for the duration, you can no longer move it, and it automatically moves 20 feet towards the closest living creature on each of your turns.

spell.name: Absolute Zero (by CaelReader)
entries: You sap even the slightest trace of heat from a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range.

All fire in the area is extinguished, and each creature in the area takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage. A creature that takes this damage must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is completely frozen in place, becoming {@condition paralyzed} for the duration.
When an affected creature takes fire damage, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on the creature.
A creature killed by this spell becomes a supercooled statue of ice that shatters into dust upon touch.

spell.name: Asylum(WIP)

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Intelligence saving throw. A target takes {@damage 7d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Zone of Deception (WIP)
entries: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

spell.name: Frostball(Beta)

components.m: a tiny ball of snow and sulfur

entries: A fast blue light flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and a chunk of ice grows on it. It then explodes into tiny ice shards in all directions. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} cold damage and is knocked {@condition prone} by the ice until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isnn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.
The explosion freezes any water in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ice Shards
entries: Five frozen shards appear and float around you and you can throw them at targets within range. You can use your bonus action to throw them one at a time or your action to throw all your remaining shards at once.
Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional shard for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Freezing Winds (WIP)

components.m: a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

entries: Freezing and violent winds rise at your command and travel along a 40 feet long and 10 feet wide line from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The path covered by the winds is covered by magical snow and becomes dificult terrain for 1 minute.
If there is non-magical snow on the ground along the line, the spell deals an additional {@dice 4d6} of cold damage.
The winds lift tiny objects that are loose on its path.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blizzard

components.m: several seeds of any moonseed plant and a piece of opalescent feldspar

entries: Strong sustained magical winds blow in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, ice and snow circulate violently inside the cylinder.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed by the blizzard, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d10} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Creatures of size Medium or smaller make their saving throw with disadvantage. If they fail, their speed is also halved until the start of their next turn. Additionally, creatures inside the blizzard have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the blizzard up to 15 feet in any direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d10|3-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fridge
entries: Faint white light sorrunds a 15-foot cube centered on a point you choose. You divide the volume into two adjacent volumes of different size; one cold and one hot.

Choose one of the faces of the cube that are perpendicular to the ground. The hot volume is the space composed by 5-foot inwards the cube from the chosen face. The cold volume is composed by the rest of the cube.

When a creature enters the spell's cold area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it loses heat and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature starts trembling and takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll. It takes half as much damage and doesn't tremble on a succesful one.

Conversely, when a creature enters the spell's hot area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it starts heating and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage with additional {@damage 1d6} per creature that has failed the saving throw inside the cold area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cold Heart(Wip)
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration it can't feel any emotions. Additionally, it has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} and disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill persuasion}) checks.

spell.name: Cool Moves (WIP)
entries: For the duration, you can add your Dexterity modifier to Charisma ({@skill performance}) checks.

spell.name: Ice Barrier

time.condition: which you take when you or an adjacent ally are the target of a ranged attack.

entries: You raise a wall of magical snow on an unoccupied space within range to protect you or an ally from an incoming missile.
The wall is at most 15 feet long and 15 feet tall but always 5 feet thick and has 10 AC and 15 hit points. It is vulnerable to fire damage and lasts for 1 minute before melting or until destroyed.

The wall acts as a full cover for all creatures of size Large or smaller that are behind it. If any of the creatures behind the wall was a target of an incoming ranged attack, the attack targets the wall instead.
If the missile deals damage that exceeds the wall's maximum hit points, the original target takes the remaining damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2nd or higher, the wall's maximum hit points increases by 5 hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Heat Transfer (WIP)

components.m: several seeds of any moonseed plant and a piece of opalescent feldspar

entries: Make a melee spell attack. On a hit the target takes blabla damage and is {@condition grappled}. At the start of its turns takes X damage. It can repeat sav throw?

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in ghostly flames that cause searing pain, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form until it leaves the spell's light.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the beam up to 60 feet in any direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|2-9|1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Snowshoes
entries: Choose a number of creatures equal to 1 + your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) that walk with two legs within range. Their footwear or their feet get the ability to walk over snow or ice without problem. These creatures ignore dificult terrain from ice or snow.

spell.name: Detect Heat
entries: For the duration, you know if there is a heat source within 30 feet of you, as well as where that source is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been in contact with a heat source similar in power to or more powerful than that of a living creature for the past 10 minutes.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone or snow, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Ice Cream (Wip)

components.m: a sprig of mistletoe

entries: Up to ten icecreams appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can use its action to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
The icecreams lose melt and lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Ice Blade (Beta)
entries: You freeze moisture in the air to create a sword of solidified magical ice in your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d8} cold damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60). In addition, when you use the sword to attack a target that is not resistant to cold damage and the sorrounding temperature is below 0 degrees Celsius, you make the attack roll with advantage.
If you drop the weapon or throw it, it melts at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause another sword to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Absolute Zero (Wip)
entries: You sap even the slightest trace of heat from a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range.

All fire in the area is extinguished, and each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 16d8} cold damage, ignoring cold resistance and is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute or until taking fire damage. On a succesful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is {@condition restrained}.
A creature killed by this spell becomes a permanent statue of ice.

spell.name: Fridge 2
entries: A faint white construct encases the area of a 15-foot cube centered on a point you can see within range. When you cast the spell, you can siphon the heat of the creatures within the construct - all creatures within the cube make a Constitution saving throw, taking XdX cold damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. Choose one side of the construct - creatures in a 10 foot area directly outside the chosen side must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or take fire damage equal to the total cold damage dealt to creatures within the construct. You can repeat this effect as an action on each or your turns until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cold Heart(Wip) 2
entries: You touch a creature - for the duration of the spell  it cannot feel any emotions, has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and has disadvantage on charisma saving throws. Unwilling creatures can make a charisma saving throw to resist the spells effect, both when it is cast, and at the end of each of their turns.

spell.name: Detect Heat 2

components.m: a petrified snake’s head

entries: For the duration, you can sense the presence and location of significant heat sources within 60 feet, such as fire or warm-blooded creatures. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been in contact with a significant heat source within the last 10 minutes.
Paladin, Ranger, Wizard

spell.name: Lightning Arc
entries: Choose two points that are at most 15 feet apart from each other within range. Each creature in a 5-foot wide line that connects them must make a Dexterity saving throw as an arc of electricity jumps between them. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage on a failed save and has disadvantage on its next attack roll, or half as much damage and doesn't have disadvantage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d10|1-9|1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tudros' Electric Field

components.m: a piece of amber

entries: You charge natural terrain in a 30-foot cube in range with electric particles and sparks of electricity can be seen jumping all around.
Creatures put to sleep or that are sleeping inside the cube automatically wake up.
Attacks and Dexterity saving throws that deal electric damage are made with advantage and disadvantage, respectfully, and deal an additional damage die.

While concentrating on this spell, you can choose a point inside the cube to quickly concentrate all the electric energy. Each creatur inside a 15-foot sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 7d6} electric damage and half as much on a succesful one.

spell.name: Fast Strike
entries: You empower your fist with electricity to strike an enemy with a quick blow. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage.
If your Dexterity score is higher than your target's, you make the attack with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|2-9|1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Electric Charge (WIP)
entries: You empower your muscles with electricity as sparks come out from your body and charge towards an enemy.

You get 10 feet of additional movement. If you move before attacking an enemy, you deal an additional {@damage 1d10} lightning damage for every 20 feet you move on a straight line on your next attack.
Your next attack You move X feet and make a melee spell attack. On a hit deal XdX lightning damage but you take half the damage dealt.

spell.name: Arcana Block(WIP)
entries: You block arcane knowledge on the mind of a creature you see. Choose a creature you can see which makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it is unable to cast any spells that you know or you have prepared.
With similar mechanics, such as the {@dice 1d20} roll for spells higher than the slot level of this spell (which should be 1st to be at least interesting), but capped to the spells you know
At the end of each of its turns repeats this saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Ideas: perhaps capping the number of spells you can block, capping the level or whichever you block is also blocked for you

My problem with this is that it's kinda polarizing, it's only good if A) You're facing a spellcaster B) That spellcaster shares spells with you C) It would've used those spells and D) It doesn't have backups that are just as good

spell.name: Armor Swap (WIP)

time.condition: which you take when an attack hits you

entries: You attempt to magically swap the armor you are wearing (if any) with that of a hostile humanoid.
The creature must be of the same size as you.
When a creature hits you with a weapon attack, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or you swap your armor with theirs until the start of your next turn.
When you swap armors this way, you also gain proficiency in the armor if the creature was proficient in it. Similarly, the creature is proficient with your armor if you are proficient in it.
When the spell ends you and the affected creature lose any armor proficiency you got.
A creature that has already had its armor swapped or succeeded the saving throw can't be targetted by this spell again for 24 hours.

spell.name: Magic Stopping Room (WIP)
entries: You create a 50-foot cube on a point you can see. Any magic item carried or worn inside the cube loses its magic properties and becomes a mundane item.

spell.name: Flow Alteration (WIP)

components.m: an hourglass

entries: You alter the flow of your current fight. For all the creatures involved in the same encounter as you, when the next combat round starts, initiative count is inverted, with the creature with the lowest initiative starting first and the one with the highest going last.
Once the round of combat ends, initiative count is reverted back to the original count.

spell.name: Magical Stomp
entries: You stomp on the ground. A magical copy of size Large of your foot appears over a point you can see within range. Creatures inside a 10-foot cube make a Strength saving throw, taking bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 3d8} + your Strength modifier and are knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save and taking half as much and aren't buried on a successful one.
A buried creature can climb its way back to the surface.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Electric Charge (Cantrip)
entries: You charge your weapon with electricity as you charge towards your enemy.

As part of the action used to cast your spell, you must move towards a target and make a melee attack. On a hit, you deal an additional {@damage 1d10} lightning damage for every 20 feet you move on a straight line on your next attack.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Sealed Kiss (WIP)
entries: You put your index finger between your lips and magically block any verbal communication coming from you.

For the duration, you cannot open your mouth and your mind can't be read or detected, Additionally, creatures can't telepathically communicate with you unless you allow it but you can't reply to them, and you have advantage on saving throws against any effect that would determine whether you are telling the truth.

You can spend your action to try and kiss a creature. Make a spell melee attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage. It must then make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition poisoned} and takes {@damage 2d10} at the start of each of its turns.
Affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

spell.name: Psychosomatic Attack (Beta)
entries: You unleash a powerful surge of psychic energy directly at the nervous system of an enemy.

Make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature. On a hit It takes {@damage 4d12} psychic damage and must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw as you try to manipulate its thoughts into believing it is hurt. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d12} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
Constructs and undeadcan't be targetted by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the  damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cards of X (WIP)

spell.name: Pain Split

time.condition: which you take when you take damage from a melee attack

entries: You channel the anguish and pain inflicted upon you by an adversary, redirecting a portion of it back at them.

Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. If the target is the creature that has attacked you, you make the attack with advantage. On a hit, you deal {@damage 2d6} damage, of the same type, to the target and reduce the incoming damage by this amount. If the result of this roll is higher than the original damage, you deal back all the damage received and take no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dream Weaver (WIP)
entries: You get into the mind of a sleeping intelligent creature.
You can take several actions.
Damage mind
Suggest course of action
Gather info

spell.name: Mental Horror
entries: You incapacitate intelligent creature. You fill the mind of the creature with macabre and horrendous images. At the start of turn they repeat saving throw. On a fail, they try to stop the viewing by scratching their eyes. They take {@dice 2d4} and become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn. A creature that spends 5 rounds or more under this condition is permanently {@condition blinded}.
You must spend your action to keep the effect.

spell.name: Nervous Touch

This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach certain levels: 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

entries: Takes X damage and slow

spell.name: Nervous Bomb
entries: A purple flash is shot from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms in an explosion of bright purple light that attacks the nervous system of nearby creatures. Each creature of your choice in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make an Intelligence saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} psychic damage on a failed save and has its Intelligence score reduced by 2, or half as much damage on a successful one and its Inteligence isn't reduced. Repeated uses of this spell against a creature already under the effects of this spell don't reduce the Intelligence score further.
Affected creatures have their Intelligence restored after 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Asylum (WIP)
entries: You unleash the madness within you and concentrate it in a 20-foot cube centered on a point you can see.

When a creature enters for the first time in a round or starts its turn inside the cube, it takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and then makes an Intelligence saving throw. Each time it fails a saving throw it takes the next effect in the list of the following effects, starting by the first and ending with the last effect .

items: The creature takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage as its mental barrier is broken.

The cognitive part of its nervous system is attacked and its perception of you is altered as it sees you as horrifying creature. The creature is {@condition frightened} by you and spends its reaction by screaming due to the mental pain.
The creature drops to the floor, becoming {@condition restrained} and {@condition prone}, while muttering incomprehensible words, as you overload its nervous system.
The creature breaks with reality and is {@condition incapacitated}.
The target becomes unconcious and gets a permanent madness.

entries: Creatures that with an intelligence score less than 4 and that are immune to both the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions are immune to this spell.

spell.name: Justice Shot (WIP)
entries: You judge a creature for its crimes and shoot pure and just energy towards it. On a hit the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage. If you are aware that the target has commited a crime, it takes {@damage 1d12} force damage instead.

The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} and {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} and {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Bestus' Paw (WIP)

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: WIP damage

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and a magical paw attacks the creature following the same path your weapon did. The paw deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach certain levels: 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10.}).

spell.name: Alasia's Lightbeam
entries: You raise your holy symbol and call forth Alasia to strike your unholy foes. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target  takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. If the target is a monstrosity or follows Daasis or Sinmos, the damage increases to {@damage 1d12}.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach certain levels: 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Hetesis' Heavy Limb
entries: You attempt to transform the limb of a creature that is moving. It must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the limp solidifies into a heavy metal until the end of the creature's turn and no effect happens on a succesful save.

Creatures with a Strength score lower than your spellcasting DC, are knocked {@condition prone} if they attempt move, while those with the score equal or above your spellcasting DC have their speed reduced by 15 feet. Nonetheless, each creature takes {@damage 1d4} force damage as their flesh changes.
(Constructs are immune to this spell)
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

Creatures inside a 10-foot cube make a Strength saving throw, taking bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 2d8} + your Strength modifier and are knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save and taking half as much and aren't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.
