entries.name: Curse of Lycanthropy
entries: A humanoid creature can be afflicted with the curse of lycanthropy after being wounded by a lycanthrope, or if one or both of its parents are lycanthropes. A {@spell remove curse} spell can rid an afflicted lycanthrope of the curse, but a natural born lycanthrope can be freed of the curse only with a wish.

A lycanthrope can either resist its curse or embrace it. By resisting the curse, a lycanthrope retains its normal alignment and personality while in humanoid form. It lives its life as it always has, burying deep the bestial urges raging inside it. However, when the full moon rises, the curse becomes too strong to resist, transforming the individual into its beast form-or into a horrible hybrid form that combines animal and humanoid traits. When the moon wanes, the beast within can be controlled once again. Especially if the cursed creature is unaware of its condition, it might not remember the events of its transformation, though those memories often haunt a lycanthrope as bloody dreams.

Some individuals see little point in fighting the curse and accept what they are. With time and experience, they learn to master their shapechanging ability and can assume beast form or hybrid form at will. Most lycanthropes that embrace their bestial natures succumb to bloodlust, becoming evil, opportunistic creatures that prey on the weak.

entries.name: Player Characters as Lycanthropes
entries: A character who becomes a lycanthrope retains his or her statistics except as specified by lycanthrope type. The character gains the lycanthrope's speeds in non-humanoid form, damage immunities, traits, and actions that don't involve equipment. The character is proficient with the lycanthrope's natural attacks, such as its bite or claws, which deal damage as shown in the lycanthrope's statistics. The character can't speak while in animal form.

A non-lycanthrope humanoid hit by an attack that carries the curse of lycanthropy must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + the lycanthrope's proficiency bonus + the lycanthrope's Constitution modifier) or be cursed. If the character embraces the curse, his or her alignment becomes the one defined for the lycanthrope. The DM is free to decide that a change in alignment places the character under DM control until the curse of lycanthropy is removed.
The following information applies to specific lycanthropes.

entries.name: {@creature Werebear}
entries: The character gains a Strength of 19 if his or her score isn't already higher, and a +1 bonus to AC while in bear or hybrid form (from natural armor). Attack and damage rolls for the natural weapons are based on Strength.

entries.name: {@creature Wereboar}
entries: The character gains a Strength of 17 if his or her score isn't already higher, and a +1 bonus to AC while in boar or hybrid form (from natural armor). Attack and damage rolls for the tusks are based on Strength. For the Charge trait, the DC is 8 + the character's proficiency bonus + Strength modifier.

entries.name: {@creature Wererat}
entries: The character gains a Dexterity of 15 if his or her score isn't already higher. Attack and damage rolls for the bite are based on whichever is higher of the character's Strength and Dexterity.

entries.name: {@creature Weretiger}
entries: The character gains a Strength of 17 if his or her score isn't already higher. Attack and damage rolls for the natural weapons are based on Strength. For the Pounce trait, the DC is 8 + the character's proficiency bonus + Strength modifier.

entries.name: {@creature Werewolf}
entries: The character gains a Strength of 15 if his or her score isn't already higher, and a +1 bonus to AC while in wolf or hybrid form (from natural armor). Attack and damage rolls for the natural weapons are based on Strength.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The wolf beast spirit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wolf beast spirit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Apex Predator
entries: The spirit has advantage on attack rolls against creatures of size Large or smaller.

trait.name: Favoured prey
entries: As a bonus action, the spirit can choose a creature it can see and set it as a favoured prey. A favoured prey gets the following penalties.
- The prey cannot hide from the spirit.
- It has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would make it {@condition frightened} of the spirit.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the beast that starts its turn within 20 feet of the beast must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw, unless the beast is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the beast's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beast makes two attacks; one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) force damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) force damage.

action.name: Howl {@recharge}
entries: The wolf howls with the strength of a thousand wolves. Each creature on a 60-foot cone must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 39 ({@damage 6d12}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much and isn't {@condition deafened} on a succesful one. If the spirit howls under a fullmoon, the saving throw is made with disadvantage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The spirit makes one bite attack or claws attack.

legendary.name: Howl (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spirit uses its howl.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The spirit moves up to half its speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). The planetar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the planetar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The angel knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: The power of life
entries: Whenever the angel deals damage to a creature, that creature takes no damage but instead regains hit points equal to the damage it would have taken.
If that creature would regain hit points above its maximum hit points, it will add any carried over hit points as temporary hit points. Temporary hit points gained this way can be added together.

Once a creature has a number of temporary hit points equal to its temporary hit points or more, it falls {@condition unconscious} and starts making death saving throws, in the same way as if it had dropped to 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
entries: The angel touches another creature. The target magically regains 30 ({@dice 6d8 + 3}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

An angel is a celestial agent sent forth into the planes to further its god's agenda for weal or woe. Its sublime beauty and presence can drive awestruck onlookers to their knees. Yet angels are destroyers too, and their appearance portends doom as often as it signals hope.

entries.name: Shards of the Divine
entries: Angels are formed from the astral essence of benevolent gods and are thus divine beings of great power and foresight.

Angels act out the will of their gods with tireless devotion. Even chaotic good deities command lawful good angels, knowing that the angels' dedication to order best allows them to fulfill divine commands. An angel follows a single driving purpose, as decreed by its deity. However, an angel is incapable of following commands that stray from the path of law and good.

An angel slays evil creatures without remorse. As the embodiment of law and good, an angel is almost never mistaken in its judgments. This quality can create a sense of superiority in an angel, a sense that comes to the fore when an angel's task conflicts with the goals of another creature. The angel never acquiesces or gives way. When an angel is sent to aid mortals, it is sent not to serve but to command. The gods of good therefore send their angels among mortals only in response to the most dire circumstances.

entries.name: Fallen Angels
entries: An angel's moral compass grants it a sense of infallibility that can sometimes spell its undoing. Angels are usually too wise to fall for a simple deception, but sometimes pride can lead one to commit an evil act. Whether intentional or accidental, such an act is a permanent stain that marks the angel as an outcast. Fallen angels retain their power but lose their connection to the deities from which they were made. Most fallen angels take their banishment personally, rebelling against the powers they served by seeking rulership over a section of the Abyss or a place among other fallen in the hierarchy of the Nine Hells. Zariel, the ruler of the first layer of the Nine Hells, is such a creature. Rather than rebel, some fallen angels resign themselves to an isolated existence on the Material Plane, living in disguise as simple hermits. If they are redeemed, they can become powerful allies dedicated to justice and compassionate service.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: An angel doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Planetar
entries: Planetars act as the weapons of the gods they serve, presenting a tangible representation of their deities' might. A planetar can call down rain to relieve a drought, or can loose an insect plague to devour crops. A planetar's celestial ears detect every falsehood, and its radiant eyes see through every deception.

Planetars are muscular and hairless and have opalescent green skin and white-feathered wings. They tower over most humanoids, brandishing immense swords with grace. Sometimes sent to aid powerful mortals on important tasks for good, planetars are especially fond of missions that involve battling fiends.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The baklur ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The baklur has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: High Speed
entries: The baklur doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Quick reflexes
entries: The baklur has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the baklur is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt and recharges its supersonic charge.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The baklur makes three attacks; one with its shocking bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shocking Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage. It has advantage on the attack roll it the target is wearing armor made of metal. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Supersonic charge {@recharge}
entries: The baklur moves up to its speed straight towards a creature it can see and makes a shocking bite attack. Additionally, any creature within 15 feet of it at the start of its movement or within 5 feet of it while it is moving as a part of this attack must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} until the end of the baklur's next turn.
Some crystals glow in the presence of monsters, forming a convenient warning system. Some monsters have learnt to outrun the light

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The pteron doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Belly armor
entries: The pteron is immune to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from attacks made by creatures that are on a lower altitude than the pteron.

trait.name: Weak spot
entries: When the pteron uses its terrorizing dive or flies down, any creatures that can see it can spend their reaction to take the search action and do a {@dc 13} Wisdom (Perception) check and realize that it has a soft protuberance on its forehead that is vulnerable to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
Creatures that have spotted this weak spot can spend their reaction when the pteron uses its terrorizing dive to make a ranged attack targetting the skull with a -5 penalty.

trait.name: Release
entries: The pteron can use its bonus action to release any creature it has {@condition grappled}. The creature then falls to the ground from the height it was released.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The pteron has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pteron makes two attacks; one with its bite and one with its talons.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and can be lifted by the pteron if it weighs 300 pounds or less.

action.name: Terrorizing dive
entries: If the pteron is at least 150 feet above the ground, it drops down towards a point it can see. Creatures within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

These flying reptiles have wingspans of 15 to 20 feet and typically dive for small marine prey, though they are opportunists and will attack any creature that appears edible. A pteranodon has no teeth, instead using its sharp beak to stab prey too large to swallow with one gulp.

entries.name: Dinosaurs
entries: Dinosaurs, or behemoths, are among the oldest reptiles in the world. Predatory dinosaurs are savage, territorial hunters. Herbivorous dinosaurs are less aggressive, but they might attack to defend their young, or if startled or harassed.

Dinosaurs come in many sizes and shapes. Larger varieties often have drab coloration, while smaller dinosaurs have colorful markings akin to birds. Dinosaurs roam rugged and isolated areas that humanoids seldom visit, including remote mountain valleys, inaccessible plateaus, tropical islands, and deep fens.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The orc can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The orc regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the orc reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the orc can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aversion to music.
entries: If the orc hears music at the start of each of its turns, it ignores other hostile creatures near it and attacks the source of the music. Additionally, it must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) damage in melee, or 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) damage at range.

reaction.name: Dislocating blow {@recharge}
entries: When the orc takes damage it makes a greatsword attack filled with rage aiming to dislocate the target's arm. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or or have disadvantage on attacks and ability checks involving Strength, Dexterity and Constitution for 1 minute. If the target or any of its allies are proficient in medicine, they can use its action on each of its turns to make a {@dc 15} medicine check and end this condition early on a success.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
entries: The orc makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The orc moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The orc targets one enemy it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of warlord's next turn.

Warlords are legendary battlefield commanders whose names are spoken with awe. After a string of decisive victories, a warlord could easily take on the role of monarch or general and attract followers willing to die for his or her banner.
The Celtadon's shrill calls are as distinct as its patterning. Its disruptive camouflage is an instrumental component to their survival.
Generally hunting in packs, the Celtadon is capable of taking down prey and predators much larger then them via guerrilla warfare.
Even blind, this species of lesser dragon can communicate almost synonymously through the use of echolocation.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The Celtadon can always take the hide action as a bonus action whenever is within 5 feet of a wall.

trait.name: Pugilist
entries: When the Celtadon has a creature of size Medium or smaller {@condition restrained} and moves, the creature moves with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The celtadon makes 3 attacks; one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Echovoice
entries: If the Celtadon is hidden it can use its action to make a sound that reverberates on surfaces. It projects its voice to a point within 80 feet of itself. Every creature within 300 feet of that point that hears the sound believes it is originated on that point. A creature can make a {@dc 17} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether the sound is legit or an echo.

Alternatively, it can produce a very loud noise on that point. All creatures within a 10-foot sphere of that point must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 22 {@damage 4d10} thunder damage and bcome deaf until the end of the celtadon's next turn on a failed save. On a success, they take half as much damage.

action.name: Tail grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled 10 feet towards it and become {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Creature throw
entries: When the Celtadon restrains a creature Medium or smaller with its tail grab attack it can use its reaction and throw it along a 20-foot line away from itself in a direction of its choice. Upon landing, the creture must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 9 {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a succesful one and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.
Additionally, if there is another creature along the line, the Celtadon makes an attack roll. On a hit, that other creature takes 9 {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The tashtari has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the tashtari's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Muzzle Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) fire damage. If it rolls a 20 on the attack roll, the target is set on fire and takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage for 1 minute. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

action.name: Bristle Flash (1/Day)
entries: The tashtari can cause its filaments to glow with intense light.

Each creature within 60 feet must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of the tashtari's next turn. This ability has no effect on sightless creatures. Tashtaris and tashtari alphas are immune to the effects of this ability.
The little guys are first, swarming by the thousands and taking out the lower, while the big guys complete the second wave over the top. Their simplicity lies only in their purpose for war.

trait.name: Vitality Syphon
entries: The face stealer can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the face stealer and creatures cannot regain hit points while inside the aura. The face stealer regains hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt. Undead and constructs ignore this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The face stealer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Daasis Roll of Madness
entries: The face stealer chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. The creature gets imbued with psychic energy attacking it through the nervous system. The creature must succed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage. On any roll of 8, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. This cantrip does not affect constructs or undead.

action.name: Face spawn (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The face stealer throws five faces into the air which quickly materialize into copies from their previous owners. On five unoccupied spaces that the face stealer can see within 60 feet of him appear a bone knight, an enchanter, a gladiator, a master thief and a warcaster.

action.name: Face steal {@recharge}
entries: The face stealer teleports to a point it can see within 30 feet and makes a touch of pain attack. On a hit, the face stealer steals the target's face and the target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and starts suffocating. A creature without a face makes a Charisma saving throw at the start of each of its turns to get back its face.

action.name: Sight Steal
entries: Each creature on a 20-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded}. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns to end this effect.
The collector can use a bonus action to see from the eyes of a creature it has stolen the sight from.

action.name: Touch of Pain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Remove Identity
entries: On a hit from a creature within 30 feet of it, the face stealer can spend his reaction to make a spell ranged or melee attack. On a hit the target takes 25 ({@damage 10d4}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or lose 2 points from its highest ability score. If two or more abilities have the same score, the affected ability is chosen at random.
An affected creature regains all lost points if the collector dies.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The face stealer uses his daasis roll of madness or touch of pain.

legendary.name: Daasis Roll of Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The face stealer casts Daasis roll of Madness

legendary.name: Face steal (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The face stealer uses his face steal, if available.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The face stealer moves up to its speed.

monster.name: Warlock of the Laughing One

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.tokenUrl: https://5e.tools/img/NTC/Warlock of the Great Old One.png?v=1.108.0

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) damage. {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or {@condition grappled} and moved towards the face.

action.name: Kiss
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) necrotic damage. Face regains half damage dealt.

monster.name: Salvar's Portrait
languages: plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The portrait's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). The portrait can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The portrait is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the portrait must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or become {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the figure in the portrait remains motionless, the portrait is indistinguishable from a normal painting.

A guardian portrait looks like a finely rendered and beautifully framed work of art, usually depicting someone important in a realistic manner. The picture and its frame are bound with powerful magic and are inseparable.

entries.name: Living Image
entries: The eyes of the figure depicted in the painting are imbued with {@sense darkvision}, and they appear to follow creatures that move in front of them.

entries.name: Innate Spells
entries: When a guardian portrait attacks, the figure in the painting animates and moves as though alive (albeit in two dimensions). The guardian portrait has no effective melee attacks, but it has a repertoire of innate spells that it can cast. When it casts a spell, the figure painted on the canvas makes all the appropriate somatic gestures and verbal incantations for the spell.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (Armoured Servant)
entries: Once per turn, the servant deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the warforged soldier that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the warforged soldier doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The servant makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shield Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the servant's next turn.

Warforged soldiers are humanoids formed from wood and steel, then magically imbued with life and sentience. The warforged were created to fight in the Last War, and in the aftermath of that conflict, they struggle to understand their place in the world.

Most warforged soldiers still serve their former masters, often guarding dragonmarked houses or merchant caravans. Many warforged find it difficult to separate themselves from the soldiers they were made to be, seeking work as bouncers, bailiffs, and bodyguards. Others put their tireless strength to work as laborers, committed to the reconstruction of the towns and cities they defended or destroyed in the war.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The first chef has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The first chef makes two attacks with its longsword.

action.name: Boiling Water {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature on a 15-foot cone must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, the first mate can choose to deal no damage with the attack to disarm the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding on the ground.

These no-nonsense sailors are the trusted allies of a pirate ship's captain. Ex-soldiers and trained mercenaries often find employment as mates aboard pirate ships. In The Sinister Secret of Saltmarsh, Bloody Bjorn serves as the first mate aboard Sea Ghost.

action.name: Acrobatic grapple
entries: https://youtu.be/Hj1Ena59NN8?t=74

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Spider Queen attacks twice with its bite or once with its bite and its Web.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

To snare its prey, a giant spider spins elaborate webs or shoots sticky strands of webbing from its abdomen. Giant spiders are most commonly found underground, making their lairs on ceilings or in dark, web-filled crevices. Such lairs are often festooned with web cocoons holding past victims.

legendary.name: Lair (Initiative count 20 AFTER round 1)
entries: While the spider is alive, roll {@dice 1d20} for each small web. On a 10 or higher, a spider spawns.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: The blade juggler can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Blade mastery
entries: The blade juggler adds a +2 bonus to his attack rolls and saving throws (already counted in his attacks) made with any weapon that has a blade.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The juggler makes three scimitar attacks.

action.name: Blade storm
entries: The blade juggler throws viciously blades at his enemies. Each creature in a 30-foot cone makes a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a succesful one.

action.name: Bleeding Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses {@dice 1d6} hit points due to blood loss at the start of each of its turns .
A creature or a creature's ally must use their action to stop the bleeding. Otherwise it ends after 1 minute.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Performance Attack {recharges after a long rest}
entries: If the juggler is below half its hit point maximum it can use its performance attack.

{@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) psychic damage. Any creature with a line of sight to the juggler must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or have their Charisma score reduced by 2 points.
A creature restores lost points from their Charisma score after finishing a Long Rest.
{@b {@i Bleeding Shot.}} El malabarista comenta {@i Splash!}

{@b {@i Performance Attack.}} {@i Ahora os mostraré, querido público, mi mayor obra, mi mejor acto. ¡Mi gran truco!.} El malabarista, fa un salt (gif). Véis como coge una espada de su cinto, la hoja de la cual empieza a coger un brillo púrpura muy leve. ¡Pero es solo por un instante, pues súbitamente pega un salto y se prepara para golpear!

Con un corte limpio en el pecho, brota un reguero de sangre, y una distorsión se propaga por toda la sala como si se tratase de una onda expansiva creada por el golpe. Sin embargo...no hay choque ni ruido que acompañe a la distorsión. Solo..., solo una una sensación de no conocerse a uno mismo. Como si uno se olvidara de quien es realmente...

legendary.name: Blade Storm (3 actions)
entries: The blade jugger uses his Blade storm.

legendary.name: Pinning shot (2 actions)
entries: The blade juggler uses his pinning shot.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Madness Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the black pudding of madness that starts its turn within 10 feet of the black pudding of madness must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw, unless the black pudding of madness is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature takes 4({@dice 1d8}) psychic damage. A creature that rolls a natural one is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Brain Control
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit -1} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}0 ({@damage 1d6 - 3}) acid damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.
A black pudding resembles a heaving mound of sticky black sludge. In dim passageways, the pudding appears to be little more than a blot of shadow.
Flesh, wood, metal, and bone dissolve when the pudding ebbs over them. Stone remains behind, wiped clean.

entries.name: Oozes
entries: Oozes thrive in the dark, shunning areas of bright light and extreme temperatures. They flow through the damp underground, feeding on any creature or object that can be dissolved, slinking along the ground, dripping from walls and ceilings, spreading across the edges of underground pools, and squeezing through cracks.

The first warning an adventurer receives of an ooze's presence is often the searing pain of its acidic touch. Oozes are drawn to movement and warmth. Organic material nourishes them, and when prey is scarce they feed on grime, fungus, and offal. Veteran explorers know that an immaculately clean passageway is a likely sign that an ooze lairs nearby.

entries.name: Slow Death
entries: An ooze kills its prey slowly. Some varieties, such as black puddings and gelatinous cubes, engulf creatures to prevent escape. The only upside of this torturous death is that a victim's comrades can come to the rescue before it is too late.

Since not every ooze digests every type of substance, some have coins, metal gear, bones, and other debris suspended within their quivering bodies. A slain ooze can be a rich source of treasure for its killers.

Whether this is true or not, the Faceless Lord is one of the few beings that can control oozes and imbue them with a modicum of intelligence. Most of the time, oozes have no sense of tactics or self-preservation. They are direct and predictable, attacking and eating without cunning. Under the control of Juiblex, they exhibit glimmers of sentience and malevolent intent.

entries.name: Unwitting Servants
entries: Although an ooze lacks the intelligence to ally itself with other creatures, others that understand an ooze's need to feed might lure it into a location where it can be of use to them. Clever monsters keep oozes around to defend passageways or consume refuse. Likewise, an ooze can be enticed into a pit trap, where its captors feed it often enough to prevent it from coming after them. Crafty creatures place torches and flaming braziers in strategic areas to dissuade an ooze from leaving a particular tunnel or room.

entries.name: Spawn of Juiblex
entries: According to the Demonomicon of Iggwilv and other sources, oozes are scattered fragments or offspring of the demon lord Juiblex.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An ooze doesn't require sleep.

legendary.name: Brain Control (Costs 3)
entries: The pudding shoots one part of itself towards trying to reach the creature's brain. {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 {@damage 1d6 } acid damage. The creature then makes a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, the creature takes 13{@damage 3d8} psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} by the pudding. Additionally, it becomes an ally of the pudding and regards as hostile the creatures that are considered hostile by the pudding.
A creature attempts to repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn. On a success, it ends the effect.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 15}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Twisted Appearance (4/ day)
entries: The creature must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, that creature see the warlock as its deepest horror and is {@condition frightened} by it until the start of the warlock's next turn. Creatures are immune to this effect if they are undead or if they have already been {@condition frightened} by the warlock in this way within the last 24 hours.

Warlocks of the Great Old One gain their powers through magical pacts forged with eldritch entities from strange and distant realms of existence. Some of these warlocks associate with cultists devoted to these entities, as well as aberrations that share their goals, yet other warlocks of the Great Old One are experts at rooting out the insanity and wickedness inspired by bizarre beings from beyond the stars.

reaction.name: Painful reaction (3d6)
entries: Whenever the warlock takes damage from a melee attack from a creature, it can spend its reaction to touch the creature and redirect part of the pain caused by the attack. Roll as many {@dice d6} from that pool as it has left. It then reduces the damage taken by the result of the roll and the attacker takes the result of the roll as psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness (2/rest)
entries: A 30-foot radius sphere of pruple colour appears centered on the cleric. The sphere moves with it, and lasts for 1 minute or until the cleric is {@condition incapacitated} or dies. Whenever a creature (including the cleric) is in the sphere, it gets one of these effects:

If the cleric sees the creature as friendly, the creature gets advantage on Wisdom saving throws or saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, as long it is inside the sphere.

If the cleric sees the creature as an enemy, the creature gets disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. In addition to that, the ceric can try to damage its enemies’ minds. At the start of the cleric's turn, he can use its action to deal psychic damage to hostile creatures inside his sphere’s aura. Creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6 + 9} psychic damage. Constructs and undeads automatically succeed this saving throw.

reaction.name: A mightier Mind (Recharges after a short rest)
entries: When the cleric gets hit by an attack it can spend its reaction to try to force your attacker to target another creature instead of him. The attacker must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or attack another creature within the reach of the attack. If two or more creatures are equally closer, the target is chosen at random. If there are no other possible targets, the attacker doesn’t attack and loses its action.

War priests worship deities of war and combat. They plan tactics, lead soldiers into battle, confront enemy spellcasters, and tend to casualties. A war priest might command an army or serve as a warlord's right hand on the battlefield.

trait.name: Vitality Syphon
entries: The face stealer can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the face stealer and creatures cannot regain hit points while inside the aura. The face stealer regains hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt. Undead and constructs ignore this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The face stealer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Daasis Roll of Madness
entries: The face stealer chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. The creature gets imbued with psychic energy attacking it through the nervous system. The creature must succed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage. On any roll of 8, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. This cantrip does not affect constructs or undead.

action.name: Face spawn (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The face stealer throws five faces into the air which quickly materialize into copies from their previous owners. On five unoccupied spaces that the face stealer can see within 60 feet of him appear a bone knight, an enchanter, a gladiator, a master thief and a warcaster.

action.name: Face steal {@recharge}
entries: The face stealer teleports to a point it can see within 30 feet and makes a touch of pain attack. On a hit, the face stealer steals the target's face and the target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and starts suffocating. A creature without a face makes a Charisma saving throw at the start of each of its turns to get back its face.

action.name: Touch of Pain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Remove Identity
entries: On a hit from a creature within 30 feet of it, the face stealer can spend his reaction to make a spell ranged or melee attack. On a hit the target takes 25 ({@damage 10d4}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or lose 2 points from its highest ability score. If two or more abilities have the same score, the affected ability is chosen at random.
An affected creature regains all lost points if the collector dies or after 24 hours.

legendary.name: Attack (1 action)
entries: The face stealer uses his daasis roll of madness or touch of pain.

legendary.name: Daasis Roll of Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The face stealer casts Daasis roll of Madness

legendary.name: Face steal (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The face stealer uses his face steal, if available.

legendary.name: Move (1 action)
entries: The face stealer moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Sight Steal (3 actions)
entries: Each creature on a 20-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded}. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns to end this effect.
The collector can use a bonus action to see from the eyes of a creature it has stolen the sight from.

trait.name: Adroit Analysis
entries: As a bonus action, the Historiarch chooses a creature that it can see within 60 feet and designate it as the target of its analysis. Whenever the historiarch makes an attack against the designated creature, using a weapon with which it is proficient that lacks the heavy property, it gains a bonus to the attack roll equal to its Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1)

trait.name: Accelerated Reflexes
entries: The Historiarch has an additional reaction each round. A single effect only triggers one reaction.

trait.name: Potent Observation
entries: When dealing damage to a creature under the adroit analysis, the historiarch deals additional {@damage 2d10} damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The historiarch makes two attacks with its rapier.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit ({@hit 12} against a creature with Adriot Analysis), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage.

reaction.name: Unyielding Mind
entries: The historiarch can add a {@dice 1d6} to an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma skill check or saving throw. If it's a saving throw, it uses this feature after rolling but before determining success.

reaction.name: Discerning Strike
entries: When a creature designated as the adroit analysis attacks the historiarch, the historiarch uses a reaction to attack it, regardless of a hit of the triggering attack.
On a hit, this attack deals additional {@dice 2d10} of piercing damage.

legendary.name: Attack (1 action)
entries: The historiarch attacks

legendary.name: Move (1 action)
entries: The historiarch moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Vital strike (2 actions)
entries: The historiarch strikes a creature on its vital parts. The historiarch makes a melee weapon attack {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 {@damage 2d8 + 9} piercing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Synaptic Jump
entries: The boar teleports itself to an empty space it can see within 30 ft as a bonus action. Creatures within 10 feet of the last space it occupied must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the boar's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boar makes two attacks; two tusk attacks or one tusk and one mental tusk attack.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mental Tusk
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage. On a hit, a creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or its Intelligence score will be reduced by 2 points until the next Long rest.

monster.name: Orc Shaman (Spiritual path of the beast)

trait.name: Spiritual Stance
entries: Allies within 30 feet of the shaman get a bonus from the following list.
- Fighting Stance. Damage rolls cannot be less than 2 and critical hits are 19-20
- Guarding Stance. Allies get 5 temporary hit points and get +1 bonus to AC and +1 to Dex saving throws.
- Cunning Stance. Allies can move up to 30 ft as a bonus action and enemies move at half speed inside the area.
The shaman can change the totem's stance as a bonus action.

trait.name: Spiritual attack
entries: When the shaman hits an enemy with an spell attack of spell of 1st level or higher, it adds {@dice 1d10} per spell level.

action.name: Deploy totem (2/day)
entries: The shaman deploys a totem in an unoccupied space within 60 ft of itself.

action.name: Spiritual Burst (3/Long rest)
entries: - Fighting Stance. Allies of the shaman and the shaman deal additional 5 force damage on damage rolls from weapons.
- Guarding Stance. Every saving throw made by a friendly creature gets a +5 on the roll.
- Cunnin stance. Friendly creatures can take disengage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Aaaaaaaaaaa
entries: Per canviar el nom. Idea és que és un del tipus de criature que ha quedat de sequela de Nournu. Està al bestiary the complete nemesis.

trait.name: Cruel Taunts
entries: Armsmen insult and belittle their
adversaries as they fight, and have an
instinctive knack for saying just the right
thing to get under their opponent’s skin.
Armsmen may use the Intimidate skill to
demoralize a foe as a move equivalent action.
An opponent who is demoralized by the
Armsman may deliver a Power Attack
modified attack against the Armsman to
immediately end the demoralized condition

trait.name: Spurn Violence
entries: Armsmen are immune to imprecise
violence, and only suffer wounds
from disciplined, controlled
swordsmen. Any attack modified by
the Power Attack feat simply fails to
affect the Armsman in any way,
regardless of the attack roll. The
weapon seems to turn to mist for a
second as it passes harmlessly through
the Armsman’s armored body

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ___ makes two blade attacks.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Vital Strike Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) slashing damage.
The Celtadon's shrill calls are as distinct as its patterning. Its disruptive camouflage is an instrumental component to their survival.
Generally hunting in packs, the Celtadon is capable of taking down prey and predators much larger then them via guerrilla warfare.
Even blind, this species of lesser dragon can communicate almost synonymously through the use of echolocation.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The Celtadon can always take the hide action as a bonus action whenever is within 5 feet of a wall.

trait.name: Pugilist
entries: When the Celtadon has a creature of size Medium or smaller {@condition restrained} and moves, the creature moves with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The celtadon makes 3 attacks; one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Echovoice
entries: If the Celtadon is hidden it can use its action to make a sound that reverberates on surfaces. It projects its voice to a point within 80 feet of itself. Every creature within 300 feet of that point that hears the sound believes it is originated on that point. A creature can make a {@dc 17} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern whether the sound is legit or an echo.

Alternatively, it can produce a very loud noise on that point. All creatures within a 10-foot sphere of that point must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 22 {@damage 4d10} thunder damage and bcome deaf until the end of the celtadon's next turn on a failed save. On a success, they take half as much damage.

action.name: Tail grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled 10 feet towards it and become {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Creature throw
entries: When the Celtadon restrains a creature Medium or smaller with its tail grab attack it can use its reaction and throw it along a 20-foot line away from itself in a direction of its choice. Upon landing, the creture must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 9 {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a succesful one and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.
Additionally, if there is another creature along the line, the Celtadon makes an attack roll. On a hit, that other creature takes 9 {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness (2/rest)
entries: A 30-foot radius sphere of pruple colour appears centered on the cleric. The sphere moves with it, and lasts for 1 minute or until the cleric is {@condition incapacitated} or dies. Whenever a creature (including the cleric) is in the sphere, it gets one of these effects:

If the cleric sees the creature as friendly, the creature gets advantage on Wisdom saving throws or saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, as long it is inside the sphere.

If the cleric sees the creature as an enemy, the creature gets disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. In addition to that, the ceric can try to damage its enemies’ minds. At the start of the cleric's turn, he can use its action to deal psychic damage to hostile creatures inside his sphere’s aura. Creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6 + 9} psychic damage. Constructs and undeads automatically succeed this saving throw.

reaction.name: A mightier Mind (Recharges after a short rest)
entries: When the cleric gets hit by an attack it can spend its reaction to try to force your attacker to target another creature instead of him. The attacker must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or attack another creature within the reach of the attack. If two or more creatures are equally closer, the target is chosen at random. If there are no other possible targets, the attacker doesn’t attack and loses its action.

War priests worship deities of war and combat. They plan tactics, lead soldiers into battle, confront enemy spellcasters, and tend to casualties. A war priest might command an army or serve as a warlord's right hand on the battlefield.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.
Commoners include peasants, serfs, slaves, servants, pilgrims, merchants, artisans, and hermits.

trait.name: Vitality Syphon
entries: The face stealer can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the face stealer and creatures cannot regain hit points while inside the aura. The face stealer regains hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt. Undead and constructs ignore this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The face stealer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Daasis Roll of Madness
entries: The face stealer chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. The creature gets imbued with psychic energy attacking it through the nervous system. The creature must succed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage. On any roll of 8, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. This cantrip does not affect constructs or undead.

action.name: Face spawn (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The face stealer throws five faces into the air which quickly materialize into copies from their previous owners. On five unoccupied spaces that the face stealer can see within 60 feet of him appear a bone knight, an enchanter, a gladiator, a master thief and a warcaster.

action.name: Face steal {@recharge}
entries: The face stealer teleports to a point it can see within 30 feet and makes a touch of pain attack. On a hit, the face stealer steals the target's face and the target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and starts suffocating. A creature without a face makes a Charisma saving throw at the start of each of its turns to get back its face.

action.name: Touch of Pain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Remove Identity
entries: On a hit from a creature within 30 feet of it, the face stealer can spend his reaction to make a spell ranged or melee attack. On a hit the target takes 25 ({@damage 10d4}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or lose 2 points from its highest ability score. If two or more abilities have the same score, the affected ability is chosen at random.
An affected creature regains all lost points if the collector dies or after 24 hours.

legendary.name: Attack (1 action)
entries: The face stealer uses his daasis roll of madness or touch of pain.

legendary.name: Daasis Roll of Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The face stealer casts Daasis roll of Madness

legendary.name: Face steal (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The face stealer uses his face steal, if available.

legendary.name: Move (1 action)
entries: The face stealer moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Sight Steal (3 actions)
entries: Each creature on a 20-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded}. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns to end this effect.
The collector can use a bonus action to see from the eyes of a creature it has stolen the sight from.

trait.name: Killing instinct
entries: The orc has a +2 on all of its attacks (already counted).

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc  can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Aversion ot Music
entries: If the orc hears music at the start of each of its turns, it ignores other hostile creatures near it and attacks the source of the music. Additionally, it must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} psychic damage.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: The orc is immune to any effects that would affect its mind or will.

trait.name: Deathstrike
entries: When the orc reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature gains one failed death saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes three greatsword attacks or two greatsword attacks and one javelin attack,.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Orcish Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rend (Cooldown 3)
entries: The deals a powerful strike that tears everything it hits, breaking armor and shields or opening a painful wound.

{@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10)} slashing damage. If the creature is wearing any non-natural or non-magical armor, the armor takes a cumulative -1 to its AC bonus. The hit creature must then succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or lose {@damage 1d10} hit points at the end of each of its turns due to blood loss.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The elite soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Iron will
entries: The elite soldier has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Knockback
entries: Once per turn, when the elite soldier hits a creature with an attack, the elite soldier can knock the creature up to 15 ft away from it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elite soldier makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: For the king! (Cooldown 6)
entries: The elite soldier slashes the enemy in front of.them.
{@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} 24 ({@damage 6d6 + 3}). The creature, loses {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of each of its turns due to blood loss.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: The elite soldier headbutts the head of its enemy to disorient it for some time. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage for 5 rounds on Constitution saving throws tinvolving concentration.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sweep {@recharge}
entries: Each creature within 5 ft. of the elite soldier must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, it takes 16 {@damage 3d6 + 5} slashing damage and loses {@dice 1d10} hit points at the start  of each of its turns due to blood loss. On a success it takes half as much damage and don't lose any hitpoints at the start of its turn.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses the elite soldier with a melee weapon attack, the elite soldier spends its reaction to make one attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The elite soldier adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The elite soldiers of Edrea are among the best of the best melee combatants of southeastern Utea. Considered as walking fortresses, due to their high-quality heavy armor, some are employed, by members of the royalty and the administrative members of the Kingdom, as bodyguards.

bonus.name: Heavy Defence
entries: The elite soldier can use a bonus action to get a +2 bonus to its AC until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The royal guard uses one of its attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The royal soldier moves up to its speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The puppeteer makes 3 string attacks.

action.name: String attachment
entries: The puppeteer attaches its strings to a victim. They must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the puppeteer for 5 rounds. If a creature has recently been attacked with a string attack, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

action.name: String
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Puppet strings
entries: {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. if fail, the target is {@condition charmed} by the puppeteer. As a bonus action, the puppeteer can command the creature. An affecte creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Thread choke (Cooldown 3)
entries: {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. or take 14 ({@dice 3d8 + 6}) plus {@damage 3d8} psychic damage. It then is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Final show
entries: When the puppeteer drops below half of its hp, starts singing a song. As he sings, the strings from his hands, spin slowly but increasingly fast,  increasing their speed with each spin. You eventually can't see them, since they spin very fast. At the start of its next turn, each creature on a DC on a 25 ft sphere take {@damage 12d12} slashing damage. A creature that drops to 0 hit points with this attack, gains two failed death saving throw.

trait.name: Attraction
entries: Once per turn, when the puppeteer hits a creature with an attack, it pulls that creature 15 ft towards itself.

action.name: Void slash
entries: Silence slashes the air in front of a creature. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage and mentally retracts to its mind and falls to the floor unresponsive and unaware to anything going on in its sorroundings.
The creature believes it has been teleported to another place.
Commoners include peasants, serfs, slaves, servants, pilgrims, merchants, artisans, and hermits.

trait.name: Mental mark
entries: When the madman attacks a creature, it makes a laughter that penetrates its mind, ressonating all the time, except when it focus its attention back to the madman. That creature has a -2 penalty to attack rolls against creatures other than the madman.

reaction.name: Stay with me
entries: When a creature tries to leave the madman's reach, even if using the disengage action, it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed becomes 0 and the madman makes an attack as part of the reaction.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

From somewhere in the darkness, a gurgling moan is heard. A form lurches into view, dragging one foot as it raises bloated arms and broken hands. The zombie advances, driven to kill anyone too slow to escape its grasp.

entries.name: Dark Servants
entries: Sinister necromantic magic infuses the remains of the dead, causing them to rise as zombies that do their creator's bidding without fear or hesitation. They move with a jerky, uneven gait, clad in the moldering apparel they wore when put to rest, and carrying the stench of decay.

Most zombies are made from humanoid remains, though the flesh and bones of any formerly living creature can be imbued with a semblance of life. Necromantic magic, usually from spells, animates a zombie. Some zombies rise spontaneously when dark magic saturates an area. Once turned into a zombie, a creature can't be restored to life except by powerful magic, such as a {@spell resurrection} spell.

A zombie retains no vestiges of its former self, its mind devoid of thought and imagination. A zombie left without orders simply stands in place and rots unless something comes along that it can kill. The magic animating a zombie imbues it with evil, so left without purpose, it attacks any living creature it encounters.

entries.name: Hideous Forms
entries: Zombies appear as they did in life, showing the wounds that killed them. However, the magic that creates these vile creatures often takes time to run its course. Dead warriors might rise from a battlefield, eviscerated and bloated after days in the sun. The muddy cadaver of a peasant could claw its way from the ground, riddled with maggots and worms. A zombie might wash ashore or rise from a marsh, swollen and reeking after weeks in the water.

entries.name: Mindless Soldiers
entries: Zombies take the most direct route to any foe, unable to comprehend obstacles, tactics, or dangerous terrain. A zombie might stumble into a fast-flowing river to reach foes on a far shore, clawing at the surface as it is battered against rocks and destroyed. To reach a foe below it, a zombie might step out of an open window. Zombies stumble through roaring infernos, into pools of acid, and across fields littered with caltrops without hesitation.

A zombie can follow simple orders and distinguish friends from foes, but its ability to reason is limited to shambling in whatever direction it is pointed, pummeling any enemy in its path. A zombie armed with a weapon uses it, but the zombie won't retrieve a dropped weapon or other tool until told to do so.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Goazard

trait.name: Sure Footed
entries: The goazard has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Multiattack
entries: The goazard makes two attacks against the same target: one with its gore and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Headbutt Charge
entries: Headbutt Charge: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning  damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonusHeader: If the goazard moves at least 10 feet straight towards a target before making a gore attack, it can make a Headbutt Charge as a bonus action.

entries: Goazards are robust, goat-lizard hybrids that inhabit the rugged landscapes of mountains, hills, and caves. Their bodies are covered in a mixture of fur and scales, providing them with both insulation and protection against the harsh elements of their habitat. Goazards are herbivorous and primarily graze on tough mountain vegetation and smaller animals, but they can be fiercely territorial and will defend their grazing grounds aggressively.

They can often be found perched on rocky outcroppings, basking in the sun or feeding on local vegetation. When faced with danger, goazards will use their horns and scaly skin to defend their territory. Despite their aggressive tendencies, they are not inherently evil creatures and may be persuaded to coexist peacefully with other species in their environment.

monster.name: Alpinshell Snail

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The alpinshell snail has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Flammable Mucus.
entries: The Alpinshell Snail's mucus is highly flammable. If the snail takes fire damage or is exposed to open flames, its mucus can ignite. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the snail while its mucus is burning takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. The mucus burns for 1 minute or until extinguished.

trait.name: Flammable Mucus Trail.
entries: The Alpinshell Snail leaves a trail of highly flammable mucus on the surface it moves across. Any open flame or spark in contact with this mucus ignites it, causing 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage per round to any creature that starts its turn in the mucus or passes through it. The mucus trail burns for 1 minute or until extinguished.

action.name: Pound
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slime Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The Alpinshell Snail releases a burst of combustible slime in a 15-foot cone that covers the ground and turns it into difficult terrain. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or fall {@condition prone}. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Retract Shell.
entries: When hit by a melee attack, the Alpinshell Snail can retract into its shell as a reaction, gaining resistance to all damage until the start of its next turn.

actionHeader: When the Alpinshell Snail hits a creature with its pound attack, the creature becomes coated with its highly flammable mucus. If the coated creature takes fire damage while covered with the mucus, it suffers an additional 4 (1d6) fire damage at the start of its turn for 1 minute or until it takes an action to clean itself, extinguishing the mucus.

entries: The Alpinshell Snail is a remarkable beast found in the rugged mountainous regions of the world. Its unique features and abilities make it a highly sought-after creature for both transportation and resource harvesting. This large, white-shelled snail is known for its raw strength, slow yet sure-footed movement, and the valuable combustible slime it produces. Adventurers and locals alike often seek these creatures for their practical uses in the challenging terrain of the mountains.
