monster.name: Little Whisper

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the little whisper has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the little whisper scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Shadow blend
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the Little Whisper has advantage on Stealth checks and can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Ethereal Gaze
entries: When the Little Whisper moves, its eyes can faintly gleam with an unnatural, ethereal light, disorienting those who see it move. Any creature that sees the Little Whisper move must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If the creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ability for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Little Whisper can't use the same claw against another target.

action.name: Terrorize (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Little Whisper releases a wave of dread and terror in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If the creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ability for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Whispering Shriek
entries: The Little Whisper can use its action to let out an unsettling, high-pitched shriek. Each creature within 30 feet of the Little Whisper that can hear it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If the creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ability for the next 24 hours. The Little Whisper can use this ability once and must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

bonus.name: Shadow Step
entries: The Little Whisper can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see in dim light or darkness as a bonus action.

actionHeader: Multiattack. The Little Whisper makes two claw attacks.

reaction.name: Evasion
entries: When subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Little Whisper instead takes no damage on a successful save, and only half damage on a failed save.

The Little Whisper is a grotesque and sinister creature born from the twisted ambitions of malevolent necromancers. This nightmarish creation stands at approximately 4 feet (1.2 m) in height, bearing a childlike presence that conceals its malevolent nature. Its pale, translucent skin and unnerving, empty black eyes give it an eerie, otherworldly appearance. With a mouth filled with needle-like teeth, elongated bony fingers ending in razor-sharp claws, and wispy hair cascading down its back, the Little Whisper wears tattered remnants of children's clothing, presenting a hauntingly innocent facade.

This undead monstrosity possesses a perpetual shadowy aura that allows it to move stealthily and blend seamlessly into the darkness. It employs an unsettling high-pitched shriek to disorient and terrify its victims. The Little Whisper excels in stealthy assassinations and kidnappings, making it a formidable tool for necromancers seeking to strike swiftly and silently, leaving behind only a trail of terror and death. Its ability to inspire fear and its penchant for vanishing into shadows make it a chilling and deadly adversary.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boaramar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@dice 3d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mordisquitos
entries: The boaramar can make a bit attack as a bonus action on creatures that are {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Inestable gut
entries: If the boar has swallowed a creature and takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or vomit the swallowed creature. The vomit spreads through a 15-foot cone and all creatures inside the cone must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw and take 11 ({@dice 3d6}) acid damage and become {@condition poisoned} on a failed roll, or half as much on a succesful roll.

trait.name: Multiattack
entries: The boaramar makes a bite and a tusk attack.

trait.name: Warming goodbye
entries: When the boaramar reaches 0 hit points, its rockets explode. Every creature inside a 20-foot sphere centered on the boaramar must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage, or half as much on a successful roll. A swallowed target automatically fails this saving throw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. At the beginning of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw to free themselves on a succesful save.

action.name: Swallow
entries: If the boaramar has a creature {@condition restrained} by the bite attack it can spend its action to swallow it. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the boaramar, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the boaramar's turns. The boaramar can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the boaramar dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire rocket flare
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage. Whenever the rocket hits a target or misses and explodes somewhere else, fire engulfes a 10-foot square on the impact location. A creature that ends its turn inside this area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. The burning area increases by 1x1 at the beginning of each round.

legendary.name: Move (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The boaramar moves up to 25 feet without triggering opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Fire rocket flare Costs (2 Actions)
entries: The boaramar launches an explosive ball of fire towards

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barghest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Fire Banishment
entries: When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be instantly banished to Gehenna

trait.name: Soul Feeding
entries: The barghest can feed on the corpse of a Fey or Humanoid it killed within the past 10 minutes. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the corpse. If the Barghest is fed, it buffs itself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barghest makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The barghest transforms into a Small goblin or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The barghest reverts to its true form if it dies.

fluff.name: Barghest
entries: Long ago, the god Maglubiyet—conqueror and then lord of early goblinoids—bargained with the General of Gehenna for aid. The General provided yugoloths, which then died in service to Maglubiyet. Yet when the time came to honor his part of the compact, Maglubiyet reneged on the deal. In vengeance, the General of Gehenna created the soul-devouring barghests to devour goblinoid souls.
The mission of every barghest, implanted in it by the General of Gehenna, is to consume souls. It eats these souls by devouring the bodies of those it kills, preferring goblinoids.

A barghest hungers for the day when it can complete its mission, return to Gehenna, and serve the General directly in his yugoloth legions, but it doesn't kill goblinoids indiscriminately. By devouring the souls of goblinoid leaders and other powerful individuals, a barghest earns elevated status in the afterlife. Barghests typically keep their true nature secret, preying on the occasional lone goblin when the opportunity arises, until they reach adulthood and are capable of seeking out stronger prey. A barghest avoids contact with large, open fires.
Any conflagration larger than its body acts as a gateway to Gehenna and banishes it to that plane, where it is likely to be slain or enslaved by a yugoloth for its failure.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.
Fanatics are often part of a cult's leadership, using their charisma and dogma to influence and prey on those of weak will. Most are interested in personal power above all else

reaction.name: Self explosion
entries: When the cultist drops to 10 hit points or less, they cast the self explosion spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The echo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The echo makes two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. Additionally, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. The echo can only have at most 2 creatures {@condition grappled} at the same time.

bonus.name: Discordant Screams
entries: The echo directs its frenzied howls at one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects of the echo's choice:

items.name: Confused Reaction
entries: The target must use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of the echo's choice that the echo can see.

items.name: Psychic Torment
entries: The target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) psychic damage.
No transformation wrought by the hand (or tentacle, whatever) of a demon lord is rightly understood as a "blessing."

Some legends claim the first ettins were orcs transformed by Demogorgon, the Prince of Demons, while others tie their origin to Grolantor or another god of the Ordning. Whatever the truth of their origin, ettins sometimes recognize a kindred soul in the two-headed Demogorgon and devote themselves to his service. Those who prove exceptionally valuable to Demogorgon's purposes in the Material Plane are rewarded with a "blessing" that transforms them into monstrous echoes of their demon patron.

The arms of an echo of Demogorgon transform into powerful tentacles, and the heads take on a more bestial appearance. The transformation leaves the echo frenzied with rage; the two heads shout and howl at each other with a fury that resounds with demonic magic, sowing discord and confusion around them. As the echo's monstrous heads roar and bite at each other, nearby creatures are racked with psychic pain or join in the ruckus, attacking their allies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the acid wolf can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The wolf exhales a blast of corrosive acidin a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The acidic swamp-dwelling wolf is as massive as a dire wolf but boasts a hide covered in corrosive hues and eyes gleaming with a malevolent acidic glow. Inhabitants of the acidic wastelands employ these sinister creatures as sentinels and partners in hunting, harnessing the wolves' lethal breath weapon against their adversaries. Acid wolves convey messages among themselves through a series of growls and barks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Covix makes 5 attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws and 2 with its tails. It can't make more than 2 attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the covix can make a lava spread attack against the target.

action.name: Lava spread
entries: Lava erupts from the covix's appendix on their paws in a 20-foot cone. Creatures inside the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 7d8} fire damage or half as much on a failed save.

action.name: Tail thrust
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} on a failed save.

action.name: Throw creature
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 15/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage. The covix throws a creature {@condition grappled} with his Tail thrust attack. On a hit, the target creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. The thrown creature also takes ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}, landing in an adjacent square next to the target. The covix can choose to make the attack against structures.

legendary.name: Lava overflow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The covix throws lava from both his hands in a 30-foot cone. Creatures inside the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage

legendary.name: Move
entries: The covix  moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail thrust
entries: The covix makes one tail thrust attack

legendary.name: Throw creature
entries: If the Covix has {@condition grappled} a creature with his Tail thrust attack, it can make a throw creature attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kaborreth makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

This enormous predator terrorizes all other creatures in its territory. Despite its size and weight, a tyrannosaurus is a swift runner. It chases anything it thinks it can eat, and there are few creatures it won't try to devour whole. While prowling for substantial prey, a tyrannosaurus subsists on carrion, and on any smaller creatures that try to dart in to steal its meal.

entries.name: Dinosaurs
entries: Dinosaurs, or behemoths, are among the oldest reptiles in the world. Predatory dinosaurs are savage, territorial hunters. Herbivorous dinosaurs are less aggressive, but they might attack to defend their young, or if startled or harassed.

Dinosaurs come in many sizes and shapes. Larger varieties often have drab coloration, while smaller dinosaurs have colorful markings akin to birds. Dinosaurs roam rugged and isolated areas that humanoids seldom visit, including remote mountain valleys, inaccessible plateaus, tropical islands, and deep fens.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The Kaborreth makes a Bite attack

legendary.name: Frenzy attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Kaborreth moves up to half its speed and makes a Bite attack

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kaborreth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite (Darkened)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Weakening Gaze
entries: The kaborreth targets one creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

This enormous predator terrorizes all other creatures in its territory. Despite its size and weight, a tyrannosaurus is a swift runner. It chases anything it thinks it can eat, and there are few creatures it won't try to devour whole. While prowling for substantial prey, a tyrannosaurus subsists on carrion, and on any smaller creatures that try to dart in to steal its meal.

entries.name: Dinosaurs
entries: Dinosaurs, or behemoths, are among the oldest reptiles in the world. Predatory dinosaurs are savage, territorial hunters. Herbivorous dinosaurs are less aggressive, but they might attack to defend their young, or if startled or harassed.

Dinosaurs come in many sizes and shapes. Larger varieties often have drab coloration, while smaller dinosaurs have colorful markings akin to birds. Dinosaurs roam rugged and isolated areas that humanoids seldom visit, including remote mountain valleys, inaccessible plateaus, tropical islands, and deep fens.

entries: The Kaborreth makes a Bite attack

legendary.name: Frenzy attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Kaborreth moves up to half its speed and makes a Bite attack

legendary.name: Terrifying Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Kaborreth releases a bone-chilling roar in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in that area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Darkened Maw
entries: The Kaborreth's Bite attack becomes infused with dark energy. On a successful hit, the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and be cursed. The cursed creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws for the next 24 hours or until the curse is lifted with a remove curse spell or similar magic.

monster.name: Leader of Ring of Sinmos Cultist

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword

Fanatics are often part of a cult's leadership, using their charisma and dogma to influence and prey on those of weak will. Most are interested in personal power above all else

reaction.name: Self explosion
entries: When the cultist drops to 10 hit points or less, they cast the self explosion spell.

bonus.name: Misty step scroll
entries: The Leader can consume a Misty step scroll to cast Misty step

monster.name: Skull taker rider (WIP)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Skull Taker makes three Battleaxe attacks or takes the and makes a dark bolt attack.

action.name: Black Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death's Grasp {@recharge 5}
entries: The Skull Taker targets one creature it can see within 60 feet, as a wave of dark energy erupts towards the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target is targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this ability, it dies.

action.name: Dark bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Sinmos' Delight (NOW A SPELL)
entries: The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and suffer disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn. Additionally, if the target is reduced to 0 hit points by Sinmos' Delightt, the Skull Taker gains advantage on its next attack roll.

trait.name: Skull mask
entries: The skull masks worn by the Skull Takers enhance their connection to Sinmos. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

trait.name: Aura of Doom
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Skull Taker must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the doom lord doesn't have the {@condition incapacitated} condition, it can suppress or resume this aura at the start of its turn (no action required).

bonus.name: Death's Harvest
entries: When the Skull Taker reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, it can use a bonus action to attempt to harvest the creature's skull. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the Skull Taker adds the creature's skull to its collection, gaining temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

bonus.name: Shadowstep
entries: As a bonus action, the Skull Taker can magically teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see in dim light or darkness.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Skull Taker adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack roll that would hit it. To do so, the Skull Taker must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

mythic.name: Carnage
entries: The Skull Taker makes two Battleaxe attacks

mythic.name: Shadow Reaper Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Skull Taker swiftly melds into the shadows, disappearing from sight, and reappears in a menacing silhouette behind a target within 30 feet. The Skull Taker then makes a Battleaxe attack against the chosen target. The sudden, unexpected nature of this strike grants advantage on the attack role for this attack. After the attack, the Skull Taker returns to its original position, leaving a chilling sensation in the air.

mythicHeader: If the Skull Taker's mythic trait is active, they can use the options below as legendary actions.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Skull Taker makes a Battleaxe attack

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Skull Taker moves up to half their speed

monster.name: Dorakan (WIP skirmisher)
actionHeader: Speed 60 ft.
Abilities:
Multiattack. Dorakan makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.
Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

Eldritch Surge. Once per turn, as a bonus action, Dorakan can tap into its dark magical origin to enhance its speed. Its movement speed increases by an additional 30 feet until the start of its next turn.
Shadow Blend. Dorakan can use its bonus action to become lightly obscured until the end of its turn. This ability allows it to blend into the shadows, gaining advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
Phasing Step. Dorakan can use its reaction to partially phase out of reality when it takes damage, granting it resistance against that damage. This ability can be used once per round.
Uncanny Dodger. Dorakan has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and can use its reaction to take half damage from a successful Dexterity saving throw.
Ambush Tactics. Dorakan gains advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprises or that is incapacitated.
Cover Exploiter. Dorakan is adept at using cover to its advantage. While in areas of dim light or darkness, it gains a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
Mobile Skirmisher. Dorakan does not provoke opportunity attacks when it makes a melee attack against a creature, and creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against it.
Actions:

Dreadful Howl (Recharge 5-6). Dorakan emits a horrifying howl that echoes through the battlefield. Each creature of Dorakan's choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.
Legendary Actions:

Dorakan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Dorakan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
Move. Dorakan moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Attack. Dorakan makes one claw attack.
Dark Pounce (Costs 2 Actions). Dorakan leaps through the shadows, reappearing next to a creature within 30 feet. It makes a bite attack against that creature.

action.name: Automatic Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +10} to hit, range 50/150 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The cultist has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the cultist has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the cultist scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: One with darkness
entries: Perception checks using sight to locate the cultist are made with disadvantage if he is in dim light or surrounded by darkness.

trait.name: Shadow Striker
entries: While the cultist is hidden, its attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the cultist can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Shadow Shatterburst
entries: The cultist throws dark pellets to a point he can see within 60 feet. Upon impact or when intentionally broken, the pellets release a non-magical darkness in a 3-foot cube centered on the point of impact. The darkness spreads around corners and creates heavily obscured areas within its radius, plunging the affected area into impenetrable blackness for 1 minute.
Creatures fully within the darkness are effectively {@condition blinded}, while those relying on darkvision can only perceive the obscured area as dim light.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. On a critical hit, a target lo (bloodied?)

action.name: Embrace Death {@recharge 5}
entries: The cultist taps into the dark energy bestowed upon them by Sinmos. It chooses up to three creatures he can see within a 30-foot radius. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and is considered "Marked by Death" for 1 minute. A marked creature takes an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage at the start of its turn. The marked condition can be removed with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw at the end of the creature's turn.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the cultist hits with it.

trait.name: Death's Grasp
entries: If the cultist is within 5 feet of a creature that is {@condition restrained}, he can make a Death Claws attack against the {@condition restrained} creature as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Death Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition restrained} against a nearby wall or the floor (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the cultist can't use Reaper's Grasp on another target.

action.name: Necrotic Lance {@recharge 5}
entries: The cultist lashes out a projectile of necrotic energy from its Scythe. Starting at 10 feet from the cultist, each creature within a 30-foot line must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw and take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and be pushed 10 feet. On a succesful save, the creatures take half as much damage and are not pushed. A pushed character that is pushed against a wall or another solid object, takes an additional {@dice 1d8} of necrotic damage.

legendaryGroup.name: Face Collector
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the face collector takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; The face collector can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@spell Pyrotechnics|xge} is casted on a point of choice within the lair that the collector can see.
All creatures within the lair are illuminated by a spotlight. Invisible creatures lose the {@condition invisible} until the next initiative count 20.

Smoke covers the face collector and a hooked creature that is within 5 feet of it and quickly vanishes. Creatures without truesight within the lair can't distinguish the face collector from the hooked creature.

regionalEffects: The region containing the collector's lair is tainted by the collector's acts and his desire of performance, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Within 5 miles of the lair, corpses of humanoids without face can be found lying around.

Within 51 mile of the lair, creatures that share a language with the face collector will hear a voice inside their heads and must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a a creature must spend their reaction by dropping what they are holding and applaud with admiration for the collector's act, whenever they see the face collector hook a creature with his face hook.

item.name: Le Noir's Greatsword
entries: This long forgotten sword confers to its attuned wielder unimaginable power.
It looks like a +1 sword, however after speaking its command word it reveals its true nature and shape
The sword has 3 charges. When the sword is in its real shape and hits an enemy, the wielder can spend one charge and deal additional {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage.
When a living creature is slain by this sword, the sword faintly glows in red
The sword regains all unexpended charges at midnight
item.reqAttune: by somebody levelling up as a Hexblade for the first time

item.name: Neoaxe
entries: While holding this battleaxe, you can spend one of its charges and cast the {@spell blinding smite} spell as part of the attack.
The axe sheds bright blue-light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10-foot radius.

item.name: Neosword
entries: While holding this greatsword, you can spend one of its charges and cast the {@spell branding smite} spell as part of the attack.
The axe sheds bright purple-light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10-foot radius.

item.name: Phantom Dancer
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon.
While wielding this magic weapon, your base movement speed increases by 10 feet.

While attuned to the Phantom Dancer, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Your body and equipment briefly turns incorporeal as you phase into the border ethereal. If you end your turn inside a creature or object, you take 1d10 force damage.

Additionally, you may choose to remain incorporeal for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus, per day. While in this form, you have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Ending your turn inside of a creature or object automatically expends one round of this feature.

item.name: Sanguine Blade
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon.
Each additional attack that hits using this weapon in a single round does a cumulative 1d4 necrotic damage (1d4 on the second successful attack, 2d4 on the third).
You heal an amount equal to half the total necrotic damage dealt.

item.name: The Bloodthirster
entries: This massive longsword cleaves through flesh like butter. It always shines bright and clean, as the blood that would wet its surface is instead drawn inside of the blade and used to channel lifeforce into its wielder.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon, which deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage.

Each round, the first attack that hits using this weapon heals you for half the total amount of damage dealt (rounded down). If this would heal you past your hit point maximum, you gain temporary hit points equal to the excess.

item.name: The Banhammer
entries: This massive golden warhammer was crafted by an almighty god of a long-forgotten time.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls using this magic weapon.
Whenever you hit an enemy with the Banhammer it is automatically Banished to an unknown plane yet to be discovered.
Nothing can bring the creature back to its original plane, not even a {@spell wish} spell.

item.name: Duskblade of Draktharr
entries: The Duskblade of Draktharr is a myth. None have ever seen it, and none know the truth of its origins. Perhaps that is because all who meet the blade perish before they know their assailant's face or have the opportunity to ask questions.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
During the first round of combat, your base movement speed is doubled.
If you use this weapon to attack a creature that you are considered hidden from, the weapon deals an additional 4d6 necrotic damage.
If you are invisible while wielding this blade, you cannot be seen by creatures with truesight.

item.name: Glacial Shroud
entries: While holding this shield, you can use an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot of 2nd level or lower. Once you have used this feature, the shield can't be used again in this way until the next dawn.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to release a glacial shroud around you covering an area inside a circle of 10 feet of radius centered on you. This area counts as heavily obscured for any creature inside. A creature with darkvision can't see inside this area.

item.name: Knight's Vow
entries: When you attune to this plate helm, you can designate an ally as a partner. While you are within 15 feet of your partner, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.
Additionally, moving toward your partner uses only half movement on regular terrain, and normal movement on difficult terrain.

When you are adjacent to your partner,and it deals damage with a melee weapon, you can spend your reaction to regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt, rounded down. Additionally, you can spend your reac

item.name: The Dark Seal
entries: While wearing this ring, you gain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) whenever you drink a Potion of Healing.

After killing a creature of challenge rating between 1 and 4, this ring grants a an extra damage die on weapon or cantrip damage rolls. This ring gives one additional die for creatures of a challenge rating between 5 and 10, 11 and 16 and 17 and 20. This feature resets when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Technopriest Sword(placeholder name)
entries: While holding this sword, you can spend one of its charges and cast the {@spell branding smite} as part of the attack. THE AXE IS MORE POWERFUL AND CASTS {@spell blinding smite}
The sword has 3 charges and you recover some at next dawn.
An extremely powerful bow.
Kurdurite adds a +2 bonus to attack rolls and +10 to weapon damage rolls.
